home.report: Despite a 43 minute rain delay Kershaw shook off a bad outing five days prior to throw six shutout innings against the Phillies in a 2-0 win. Kershaw worked out of a pair of jams both of which came after the delay.

away.report: Bailey wasn't at his sharpest against the Cardinals on May 23, giving up three runs on eight singles in six innings, but he got the win as the Reds prevailed, 5-3. In eight career starts against the Dodgers, the right-hander is 3-3 with a 4.01 ERA.

mlb.headline: No rest for Reds as Dodgers call on Kershaw
mlb.blurb: The Reds were nearly the victims of a perfect game by Hyun-Jin Ryu on Monday, then they faced 7-1 right-hander Zack Greinke on Tuesday. On Wednesday, Homer Bailey and the Reds draw two-time NL Cy Young Award winner Clayton Kershaw.

home.headline: No rest for Reds as Dodgers call on Kershaw
home.blurb: The Reds were nearly the victims of a perfect game by Hyun-Jin Ryu on Monday, then they faced 7-1 right-hander Zack Greinke on Tuesday. On Wednesday, Homer Bailey and the Reds draw two-time NL Cy Young Award winner Clayton Kershaw.

away.headline: No rest for Reds as Dodgers call on Kershaw
away.blurb: The Reds were nearly the victims of a perfect game by Hyun-Jin Ryu on Monday, then they faced 7-1 right-hander Zack Greinke on Tuesday. On Wednesday, Homer Bailey and the Reds draw two-time NL Cy Young Award winner Clayton Kershaw.

home.headline: Kershaw gets stung by Reds' fast start
home.blurb: Clayton Kershaw struck on nine in seven innings, but the Dodgers managed little more than a Yasiel Puig homer against right-hander Homer Bailey in a 3-2 loss to the Reds in Wednesday's series finale at Dodger Stadium.

away.headline: Phillips' homer helps Bailey outduel Kershaw
away.blurb: Brandon Phillips' first-inning homer gave the Reds their first lead in five games, and Homer Bailey held onto it in Wednesday night's series finale against Clayton Kershaw and the Dodgers in Los Angeles.

mlb.headline: Homer pens a happy ending in Hollywood
mlb.blurb: Brandon Phillips' first-inning homer gave the Reds their first lead in five games, and Homer Bailey didn't let it go. The right-hander outdueled Dodgers ace Clayton Kershaw for seven innings in the series finale as Cincinnati ended its four-game skid in Los Angeles.

item.headline: Bailey's strong start
item.blurb: CIN@LAD: Bailey tosses seven innings of two-run ball
item.big_blurb: 5/28/14: Homer Bailey pitches seven strong innings, allowing two runs on five hits while striking out six batters

ipad.caption: Homer pens a happy ending in Hollywood
